subject: Ethics
title: Prenatal Genetic Testing Dilemmas
description: A short lesson to help you apply Prenatal Genetic Testing Dilemmas.

hook.text: A test says your unborn child will be deaf. Do you continue the pregnancy? The Deaf community says yes.

buildup.text: Prenatal testing can detect hundreds of genetic conditions weeks into pregnancy.

discovery.text: In Iceland, nearly 100% of pregnancies with Down syndrome are terminated after testing.

twist.text: Disability advocates argue this isn't healthcareâ€”it's eugenics with a friendly face.

climax.text: The tension: parental autonomy says choose freely, but society's patterns can erase entire communities.

punchline.text: Individual choices can add up to collective elimination.

quiz.question: Why do some disability advocates criticize widespread prenatal genetic testing?
options: Individual termination choices can collectively eliminate entire communities
Prenatal testing is too expensive to be fair
